ll","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Provides an on-chain interface for a trusted off-chain oracle service      to push risk parameters (like APR) for specific projects to their      respective funding contracts (DirectProjectVault or LiquidityPoolManager).      Uses UUPS for upgradeability.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address)":[{"details":"The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid."}],"ERC1967NonPayable()":[{"details":"An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost."}],"FailedCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted."}],"InvalidInitialization()":[{"details":"The contract is already initialized."}],"NotInitializing()":[{"details":"The contract is not initializing."}],"UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext()":[{"details":"The call is from an unauthorized context."}],"UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32)":[{"details":"The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID."}]},"events":{"AssessmentIntervalUpdated(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the assessment interval is updated.","params":{"newInterval":"The new interval in seconds.","oldInterval":"The old interval in seconds."}},"BatchRiskAssessmentTriggered(uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a batch risk assessment is triggered.","params":{"timestamp":"The timestamp of the trigger."}},"Initialized(uint64)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"PeriodicAssessmentRequested(uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a periodic assessment is requested for a project.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","timestamp":"The timestamp of the request."}},"ProjectRiskLevelSet(uint256,uint16)":{"details":"Emitted when a project risk level is set.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","riskLevel":"The risk level set for the project."}},"RiskParamsPushed(uint256,address,address,uint16,uint48)":{"details":"Emitted when risk parameters are successfully pushed to a target contract.","params":{"aprBps":"The Annual Percentage Rate in basis points pushed to the target.","oracle":"The address of the oracle that pushed the parameters.","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","targetContract":"The address of the contract the parameters were pushed to.","tenor":"The loan tenor in days pushed to the target (optional, may not be updated post-funding)."}},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"TargetContractSet(uint256,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when a target contract is set or updated for a project ID.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","setter":"The admin address that set the target contract.","targetContract":"The address of the contract (Vault or PoolManager) that manages the project's loan."}},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"getPoolId(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The project ID."},"returns":{"_0":"uint256 The pool ID, or 0 if not a pool-managed project or not set."}},"getProjectRiskLevel(uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."},"returns":{"_0":"uint16 The risk level of the project."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getRoleMembers(bytes32)":{"details":"Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block."},"getTargetContract(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The project ID."},"returns":{"_0":"address The target contract address (Vault or PoolManager)."}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address)":{"details":"Uses `initializer` modifier for upgradeable contracts.","params":{"_admin":"The address to grant initial administrative privileges (DEFAULT_ADMIN, UPGRADER, ORACLE)."}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"pushRiskParams(uint256,uint16,uint48)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`.      Looks up the `targetContract` and calls the appropriate update function      (`updateRiskParams`) on either the Vault or the PoolManager.","params":{"aprBps":"The new Annual Percentage Rate in basis points (1% = 100 BPS).","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project receiving the update.","tenor":"The new loan tenor in days (optional, may not be applicable post-funding, use 0 if unchanged)."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"requestPeriodicAssessment(uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`.      Checks if enough time has passed since the last assessment.      If so, updates the last assessment timestamp and emits an event.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setAssessmentInterval(uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`.","params":{"newInterval":"The new interval in seconds."}},"setProjectRiskLevel(uint256,uint16)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","riskLevel":"The risk level to set for the project."}},"setTargetContract(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`.      This maps a project to its managing contract (Vault or PoolManager).      For pool-managed projects, also sets the `poolId`.","params":{"poolId":"The ID of the pool managing the project (only relevant if `targetContract` is a PoolManager, otherwise use 0).","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","targetContract":"The address of the `DirectProjectVault` or `LiquidityPoolManager`."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"triggerBatchRiskAssessment()":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"stateVariables":{"assessmentInterval":{"details":"The default interval between periodic assessments."},"lastAssessmentTimestamp":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to the timestamp of the last assessment.      Used to track the last time a project was assessed."},"projectPoolId":{"details":"Mapping from project ID (specifically for pool-funded loans) to the pool ID within the PoolManager.      Needed because PoolManager functions often require both poolId and projectId.      Only set for projects handled by LiquidityPoolManager."},"projectRiskLevels":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to the risk level of the project."},"projectTargetContract":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to the address of the target contract (Vault or PoolManager)      that should receive risk parameter updates for that project."}},"title":"RiskRateOracleAdapter","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"getPoolId(uint256)":{"notice":"Gets the pool ID registered for a specific project ID (if applicable)."},"getProjectRiskLevel(uint256)":{"notice":"Gets the risk level for a project."},"getTargetContract(uint256)":{"notice":"Gets the target contract address registered for a specific project ID."},"initialize(address)":{"notice":"Initializes the contract, setting the initial admin and roles."},"pushRiskParams(uint256,uint16,uint48)":{"notice":"Pushes risk parameters (APR, optional Tenor) to the target contract associated with the project ID."},"requestPeriodicAssessment(uint256)":{"notice":"Requests a periodic assessment for a project."},"setAssessmentInterval(uint256)":{"notice":"Sets the assessment interval for periodic risk assessments."},"setProjectRiskLevel(uint256,uint16)":{"notice":"Sets the risk level for a project."},"setTargetContract(uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Sets or updates the target contract address for a given project ID."},"triggerBatchRiskAssessment()":{"notice":"Automatically triggers risk assessment for all returns._0: uint256 The pool ID, or 0 if not a pool-managed project or not set.

params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

returns._0: uint16 The risk level of the project.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

returns._0: address The target contract address (Vault or PoolManager).

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._admin: The address to grant initial administrative privileges (DEFAULT_ADMIN, UPGRADER, ORACLE).

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

pushRiskParams(uint256,uint16,uint48).details: Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`.      Looks up the `targetContract` and calls the appropriate update function      (`updateRiskParams`) on either the Vault or the PoolManager.

params.aprBps: The new Annual Percentage Rate in basis points (1% = 100 BPS).
params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project receiving the update.
params.tenor: The new loan tenor in days (optional, may not be applicable post-funding, use 0 if unchanged).

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

requestPeriodicAssessment(uint256).details: Requires caller to have `RISK_ORACLE_ROLE`.      Checks if enough time has passed since the last assessment.      If so, updates the last assessment timestamp and emits an event.

params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.
params.riskLevel: The risk level to set for the project.

setTargetContract(uint256,address,uint25.details: Requires caller to have `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`.      This maps a project to its managing contract (Vault or PoolManager).      For pool-managed projects, also sets the `poolId`.

params.poolId: The ID of the pool managing the project (only relevant if `targetContract` is a PoolManager, otherwise use 0).
params.projectId: The unique identifier of the project.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

getPoolId(uint256).notice: Gets the pool ID registered for a specific project ID (if applicable).

getProjectRiskLevel(uint256).notice: Gets the risk level for a project.

getTargetContract(uint256).notice: Gets the target contract address registered for a specific project ID.

initialize(address).notice: Initializes the contract, setting the initial admin and roles.

pushRiskParams(uint256,uint16,uint48).notice: Pushes risk parameters (APR, optional Tenor) to the target contract associated with the project ID.

requestPeriodicAssessment(uint256).notice: Requests a periodic assessment for a project.

setAssessmentInterval(uint256).notice: Sets the assessment interval for periodic risk assessments.

setProjectRiskLevel(uint256,uint16).notice: Sets the risk level for a project.

setTargetContract(uint256,address,uint25.notice: Sets or updates the target contract address for a given project ID.

triggerBatchRiskAssessment().notice: Automatically triggers risk assessment for all projects.
